    • Constructor Detail

      • SPage

        public SPage(SPage page)
        Copy-constructor.
        Parameters:
        page - SPage to copy from. It will also copy the "opened" status.

      • SPage

        public SPage(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
     SPageConfig config)
        Construct a Page Object, already opened. This is used to when a Page interaction causes navigation to another page. NOTE: Calls to SPage#open() will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        driver - WebDriver intance, initialised and with the page already loaded.
        config - SPageConfig to use for this SPage

      • SPage

        public SPage(SEnvConfig envConfig,
     java.lang.String driverName,
     SPageConfig pageConfig,
     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> pathParams,
     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queryParams)
        Construct a Page Object, not yet opened. It validates the input parameters, checking if the requested driver exists, if the page exists and the mandatory path and query parameters are all provided. NOTE: The returned SPage hasn't loaded yet, so the User can still operate on it before the initial HTTP GET.
        Parameters:
        envConfig - Sulfur Environment Configuration
        driverName - Desired WebDriver NameÂ 
        pageConfig - Sulfur Page Configuration
        pathParams - Map of parameters that will be set in the SPage URL Path (@see SPageConfig)
        queryParams - Map of parameters that will be set in the SPage URL Query (@see SPageConfig)

    • Method Detail

      • addCookie

        public void addCookie(org.openqa.selenium.Cookie cookie)
        Adds a Cookie to a Page. Usually this will be used when isOpen() is still false.
        Parameters:
        cookie - Cookie to set on the Page

      • open

        public SPage open()
        Open the Page. It emulates the action of the User. NOTE: An Opened page can't be reopened.
        Returns:
        The same SPage object: useful for call chains

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes of a Page. After this, the Page object and the internal Driver become unusable (i.e. WebDriver is quitted). I blame it on Java's lack of destructor.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        Returns "false" before the SPage#open() method has been invoked.

      • hasLoaded

        public boolean hasLoaded()
        Returns "true" if the SPage has loaded, "false" otherwise. To check for loaded status, it queries all the SPageComponent inside: if all have loaded, the page has loaded.
        Returns:
        "true" if/when all SPageComponent inside the SPage have loaded.

      • waitForLoad

        public void waitForLoad(long timeout)
        Refer to waitForLoad(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
        Parameters:
        timeout - Time before giving up

      • waitForLoad

        public void waitForLoad(long timeout,
               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Refer to waitForLoad(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
        Parameters:
        timeout - Time before giving up
        unit - Time Unit

      • waitForLoad

        public void waitForLoad(long timeout,
               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeoutUnit,
               long polling,
               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit pollingUnit)
        Wait for SPage to Load. It will wait for all the internal SPageComponent to finish loading
        Parameters:
        timeout - Time before giving up the waiting
        timeoutUnit - Time Unit used by timeout parameter
        polling - Time interval between checking if SPage has loaded
        pollingUnit - Time Unit used by polling parameter

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Name of the Page, based on the SPageConfig

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        Current Page title.

      • getInitialUrl

        public java.lang.String getInitialUrl()
        URL used at time the SPage object was constructed.
        Returns:
        URL used at time the SPage object was constructed.

      • getCurrentUrl

        public java.lang.String getCurrentUrl()
        URL the SPage's internal Driver is at.
        Returns:
        URL the SPage's internal Driver is at.

      • getSource

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        Returns:
        Current Page source code (i.e. the HTML)

      • getComponent

        public SPageComponent getComponent(java.lang.String componentName)
        Get SPageComponent from the SPage
        Parameters:
        componentName - Name of the Component we are interested in
        Returns:
        The SPageComponent we are after

      • getComponents

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SPageComponent> getComponents()
        Returns:
        A Map of all the Components that compose the Page (note: based on the Page Configuration).

      • getDriver

        public org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getDriver()
        Returns the Driver used by this SPage. The assumption is that you know what a WebDriver is an the effect that you will have manipulating it directly. It's advisable you use SPageComponent(s) instead.
        Returns:
        The WebDriver in use to this SPage Object
